metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: SVG can be used together with JavaScript to modify and animate SVG elements.
content.html: SVG can be used together with JavaScript to modify and animate SVG elements.

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle with a radius of 25. Click the button to change the radius to 50:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle with a radius of 25. Click the button to change the radius to 50:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle id="circle1" cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;" 
/>
</svg>


<input type="button" value="Change Radius" onclick="changeRadius()" />


<script>function changeRadius() {

document.getElementById("circle1").setAttribute("r", "50");}</script>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle id="circle1" cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;" />
</svg>

<input type="button" value="Change Radius" onclick="changeRadius()" />

<script>
function changeRadius() {
  document.getElementById("circle1").setAttribute("r", "50");
}
</script>

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle. Click the button to change the fill color to green:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle. Click the button to change the fill color to green:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle id="circle2" cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;" 
/>
  
Sorry, your browser does not support inline SVG.
</svg>

<input 
type="button" value="Change Style" onclick="changeStyle()" />

<script>
function changeStyle() {  document.getElementById("circle2").style.fill="green";
}</script>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle id="circle2" cx="50" cy="50" r="25" style="fill:red;" />
  Sorry, your browser does not support inline SVG.
</svg>

<input type="button" value="Change Style" onclick="changeStyle()" />

<script>
function changeStyle() {
  document.getElementById("circle2").style.fill="green";
}
</script>

content.text: SVG Change Attribute Values and CSS
In this example, we create a red circle. Click the button to change the radius, the x position, fill color, and add a stroke color:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle. Click the button to change the radius, the x position, fill color, and add a stroke color:

content.code:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  
<circle id="circle3" cx="50" cy="60" r="25" style="fill:red;" 
/>
</svg>

<input 
type="button" value="Change Circle" onclick="changeMe()" />

<script>function 
changeMe() {  var c = document.getElementById("circle3");
c.setAttribute("r", "50");  c.setAttribute("cx", "150");
c.style.fill="green";  c.style.stroke="red";}</script>
content.code_html:
<svg width="200" height="120" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle id="circle3" cx="50" cy="60" r="25" style="fill:red;" />
</svg>

<input type="button" value="Change Circle" onclick="changeMe()" />

<script>
function changeMe() {
  var c = document.getElementById("circle3");
  c.setAttribute("r", "50");
  c.setAttribute("cx", "150");
  c.style.fill="green";
  c.style.stroke="red";
}
</script>

content.text: In this example, we create a red circle. Click the two buttons to start and stop the animation:
content.html: In this example, we create a red circle. Click the two buttons to start and stop the animation:

content.code_html:
<svg width="600" height="100" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <circle id="circle4" cx="50" cy="50" r="50" style="fill:red;" />
</svg>

<script>
var t = null;

function start() {
  if(t == null) {
    t = setInterval(animate, 20);
  }
}

function stop() {
  if(t != null) {
    clearInterval(t);
    t = null;
  }
}

function animate() {
  var circle = document.getElementById("circle4");
  var cx = circle.getAttribute("cx");
  var newCX = 2 + parseInt(cx);
  if(newCX > 600) {
    newCX = 50;
  }
  circle.setAttribute("cx", newCX);
}
</script>

<br/>
<input type="button" value="Start" onclick="start()" />
<input type="button" value="Stop" onclick="stop()" />
